rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
No loaded rhetorical question is present in the text.
The segment reports on test results and cause of death, which is factual information, not explicit calming language.
Segment does not contain a minimiser combined with a scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment describes a fact/finding, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment reports animals died because of the virus, not specific metrics.
The segment reports a past event ('died'), not speculation about future relief.
Quote within attributed statement is a factual statement about cause of death (technical term), not framed.
Reports factual event (died) and cause, attributed to source; stated factually.
